MouseEventMovementX.summary:
The movementX read-only property of the interface provides the difference in the X coordinate of the mouse pointer between the given event and the previous event.
In other words, the value of the property is computed like this: currentEvent.movementX = currentEvent.screenX - previousEvent.screenX.

blockquote.para: Warning: Browsers use different units for movementX and than what the specification defines. Depending on the browser and operating system, the movementX units may be a physical pixel, a logical pixel, or a CSS pixel.
